intro: Schmaltzia illinoensis, commonly known as the Illinois schmaltzia, is a perennial herb native to the central United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Schmaltzia illinoensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and wetlands. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists studying native flora.
